Title: O. Wilcken 1339
Description: Red pottery ostracon, from the body of a vessel, interior grooved, with remains of four horizontal Greek and three vertical demotic lines of black-painted text, both smudged and faded, on the exterior.
Curator's comments: Almásy-Martin, A./Martin, C. J. 2021: Always Remember to Check the Back: A Closer Look at Some Published Ostraca in the British Museum and British Library, in: Stolk, J. V./van Loon, G. A. J. C. (eds.), Text Editions of (Abnormal) Hieratic, Demotic, Greek, Latin and Coptic Papyri and Ostraca, P. L. Bat. 37, Leiden/Boston, 33–56.
Currently under study by Pierre-Luc Angles (Heidelberg) with a view to publication [ERO 2019]
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (77691) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/77691)
Wilcken 1899 / Griechische Ostraka aus Aegypten und Nubien Ein Beitrag zur antiken Wirtschaftsgeschichte (p. 358, no. 1339.)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
